body.name: Blossoming into a Lady: A Historical Regency Romance Novel
body.description: Lady Daphne Westbrook returns to London after a self-imposed exile, determined to shield herself from further heartache. Rejected by her once inseparable childhood friend, Lord Adrian Fairbourne, she cannot imagine her walls shattering into pieces after facing him again. Her sister's impending marriage though forces her back into the unforgiving society she once fled from. Blossoming from a wounded bird into the most eligible Lady, she will soon find herself lost among family expectations and fate’s unexpected twists.Will her return mean a new beginning or will the past haunt her future?Adrian, burdened by the weight of his newfound dukedom, grapples with the ghosts of a critical father and the consequences of a past misjudgment. As his mother nudges him towards matrimony, the Westbrook betrothal ball becomes a battleground of emotions. In a quest for solace, he seeks refuge at a veterans' sanctuary with his cousin, pledging himself to a noble cause. However, his journey takes an unexpected turn when he encounters his enduring rival, casting a shadow over his life.Will his reunion with Daphne heal his troubled heart?As Daphne and Adrian's worlds collide once more, old wounds are reopened, and new challenges emerge. Will Daphne and Andrian’s bond rekindle like the flame that still flickers in their hearts, or will the spark between them become extinguished by the old grievances? Will they find redemption and the way back to each other’s hearts or will deception and prejudice tear them apart forever?"Blossoming into a Lady" is a historical romance novel of approximately 80,000 words. No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a guaranteed happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Adrian and Daphne were childhood friends who loved each other. Daphne expressed her love to Adrian and he told her he loved her like a sister. She was so hurt she left for two years.Daphne back for her sister wedding she doesn't know what will happen when she sees Adrian. Adrian talks to Daphne but she won't accept his apology.Daphne decide to move on with her life and see Lord Waters who is only after her money and family connections. Edmund uses another to help him get what he wants.Will Adrian find the information in time to help Daphne? Sweet love story where love wins in the end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Daphne and Adrian
reviews.reviewText: Daphne and Adrian were friends since their youth, but when Daphne announces she loves Adrian, he responds in an unintentional hurtful way. Their lives then separate, and after two years, Adrian returns and their paths cross at a ball. This is an emotional story as each character misunderstands behaviors and actions, which separates them further. Adrian’s character had drawn out insecurities and his reluctance to take a step forward was a bit unnerving. I enjoyed the story, but felt the book could have lost several chapters in the middle, and it would have still been a cohesive story, as I felt some areas in the middle were repetitive. The last third of the story was great. Aware of nefarious characters throughout, they really took center stage which ramped up the endings excitement. The book also needed another review by an editor, as there were several word mistakes. I received a complimentary ARC, but I am voluntarily offering my personal opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Struggling with Regret
reviews.reviewText: A very good tale with an important message -- don't live your life in an attempt to please others! Adrian's angst is believable and Daphne's woundedness is too. Determined to not let Adrian hurt her again she has some very tall walls built around her, but circumstances and a meddling matron are determined to tear them down. There is quite the plot twist that adds supsense. Overall a very enjoyable read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Enjoyable but frustrating
reviews.reviewText: Error in final chapter: "heartache we bother sufferred in past two years" bother should be bothI really felt that author drug out the angst of forced marriage too long. Adrian should have been honest with himself sooner and made a better effort to stop the forced marriage. He's still letting his father's attitudes weigh too much in his behavior.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Adrian and Daphne
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyable, nice long story. Likeable characters. Well written, for the most part.At the dance, Adrian reflects that he had only danced with his mom and sister, besides Daphne. But he danced the first one with the Hawthorn heiress.Also, it gets confusing at the wedding where events don't seem to lineup with the timeline of Daphne and Adrian's perspectives.But a good story with exciting events make for a good read. Recommended.Thanks, Eliza

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Doing one's duty
reviews.reviewText: Adrian wants his father's approval and feels he has a duty to do so which leads to hurt, disillusionment and pain. The novel follows the trail of doing one's duty and following the dictates of the ton. It's a lovely story highlighting the emotions and struggles the characters face in the hopes of one day finding happiness.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The heroine and hero have known each other since childhood, but when she announces she loves him, his reply wounds her deeply. They don’t see each other for two years. The hero has insecurities and new responsibilities as a duke. The heroine wants to protect her heart. There are some secondary characters that add intrigue to the story as these two circle each other until they get their HEA. There were some editing mistakes, although the storyline didn’t lag because of them, but I felt the middle of the book could have been more condensed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tell the truth
reviews.reviewText: This story is about the unrequited love between two best friends. A simple untruth will break both their hearts until they find the courage to admit their love. Of course there are people trying to stop them. It's a nailbiter ending that you can't put down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: When All Is Not What It Seems
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this well-written story. Adrian and Daphne were childhood friends and met often at social events, as they grew up. At a ball, Daphne decided to tell Adrian how strongly she felt about him. He replied that he loved her as a friend. Daphne was devastated and hid herself away from events for two years. When she returned for her sister's wedding she met Adrian again. He had always loved her but had made the wrong decision and regretted it. Would he be able to make Daphne understand and accept his apology? Unfortunately, there is deception and forgery which threatened to stop Adrian's plans. Will Daphne be able to understand why Adrian acted as he did? Will Adrian be in time before the love of his life is married to someone else? Read on and enjoy.
